resources.string: In Order To Get Suitable Recommendations,\nPlease Fill In The Data First. Thank You!
Is there a history of overweight in your family?
How often do you consume vegetables and fruit every week?
How many main meals do you consume each day?
Do you often eat between your main meals?
How many times a day do you consume water?
Do you monitor your calorie consumption?
How many times a week do you do physical activity?
How much time do you spend using your tech devices every day?
How frequently do you use transport?
How often have you had obesity-related check-ups in the past three months?

Congratulations! The detection results show that you are in the normal category. This means your weight is within a healthy range. Maintain a balanced diet and exercise routine to keep your body healthy. Continue this healthy lifestyle for long-term wellbeing.
Apakah anda ingin membatalkan perubahan pada form?
Apakah anda yakin ingin menghapus item ini?

Full cream milk or high-calorie milk: Helps increase calories and protein. 

 Fruit smoothies: Smoothies made from fruits such as banana, mango and avocado mixed with yoghurt or full-fat milk. 

 Fresh fruit juice: Mango, banana or orange juice with honey added to increase calories. 

 Milk tea or latte: Tea or coffee drinks with milk to increase calorie intake. 

 Protein-based drinks: Protein supplements or protein-based milkshakes to increase protein consumption.

Low carbohydrates: Non-starchy vegetables such as broccoli, spinach, zucchini, carrots and cabbage. 

 Protein: Lean meat, fish, chicken, tempeh, tofu, nuts. 

 Healthy fats: Avocado, olive oil, almonds (in moderation). 

 Low-fat dairy products: Skimmed milk, low-fat yoghurt. 

 Foods high in fibre: Fruits such as apples, pears and strawberries; and nuts and seeds. 

 Avoid added sugar and processed foods.

Complex carbohydrates: Brown rice, oatmeal, wholemeal bread, pasta, potatoes.

 High protein: Eggs, lean meat, fish, chicken, tempeh, tofu, nuts. 

 Healthy fats: Avocado, olive oil, nuts, chia seeds, almonds. 

 High-fat dairy products: Cheese, full cream milk, high-fat yoghurt. 

 Fruits and vegetables: Banana, mango, papaya, apple, spinach, broccoli, carrot.

Carbohydrates: Healthy carbohydrate sources such as brown rice, quinoa, wholemeal bread, potatoes and vegetables. 

 Protein: Fish, chicken, eggs, beans, and tempeh tofu. 

 Healthy fats: Olive oil, avocado, almonds, fatty fish (salmon, sardines). 

 Vegetables and fruits: Various green vegetables (spinach, kale), and fruits with high vitamin C content (oranges, kiwi).

Low carb: Green vegetables (spinach, kale, mustard greens), broccoli, cauliflower, zucchini, carrots. 

 Protein: Fish (salmon, tuna), skinless chicken breast, tempeh, tofu, eggs. 

 Healthy fats: Olive oil, almonds (in moderation), chia seeds, flax seeds. 

 High fibre: High-fibre fruits (apples, pears, berries), nuts and seeds.

Full cream milk or high-calorie milk: Helps increase calories and protein. 

 Fruit smoothies: Smoothies made from fruits such as banana, mango and avocado mixed with yoghurt or full-fat milk. 

 Fresh fruit juice: Mango, banana or orange juice with honey added to increase calories. 

 Milk tea or latte: Tea or coffee drinks with milk to increase calorie intake. 

 Protein-based drinks: Protein supplements or protein-based milkshakes to increase protein consumption.

Water: Essential for maintaining hydration and general body health. 

 Green tea: Rich in antioxidants and can help boost metabolism. 

 Fresh fruit juice: Juices with little added sugar, such as orange, apple or berry juice. 

 Coconut water: Refreshing and hydrating, rich in electrolytes. 

 Low-fat dairy-based drinks: Skimmed milk or low-fat yoghurt

Cardio exercise: Fast walking, jogging, cycling, swimming or treadmill for effective calorie burning. 

 High-intensity interval training (HIIT): Combines periods of intense activity with recovery periods for maximum calorie burn in a short period of time. 

 Strength training: Lift weights at light to moderate intensity to increase muscle mass and metabolism. 

 Zumba or aerobics: A fun, full-body workout to increase stamina and calorie burn. 

 Flexibility and mobility training: Yoga or pilates to reduce the risk of injury, improve flexibility and balance.

Water: Drinking enough water is essential for boosting metabolism and controlling hunger. 

 Green tea: Known to aid fat burning and boost metabolism. 

 Herbal tea: Teas such as chamomile or peppermint can aid digestion and reduce hunger. 

 Infused water: Naturally flavoured water from fruits like lemon or cucumber to aid hydration with minimal calories. 

 Warm lemon water: Can help detoxify the body and boost metabolism. 

 Green vegetable juices: Juice from vegetables that are low in calories and high in fibre, such as spinach and celery.

Strength training: Weight lifting, push-ups, squats, deadlifts, and other strength exercises to build muscle. 

 Upper body exercises: Dumbbell presses, pull-ups, barbell rows to increase muscle mass in the upper body. 

 Lower body exercises: Squats, lunges, leg presses to build leg muscles. 

 Core exercises: Plank, Russian twist to strengthen core muscles. 

 HIIT (High-Intensity Interval Training): Although high-intensity, HIIT can help boost metabolism without compromising muscle mass if done the right way.

Strength training: Lift light to moderate weights to maintain muscle strength. 

 Moderate cardio: Running, cycling, swimming or brisk walking to maintain heart health and fitness. 

 Yoga or Pilates: Good flexibility exercises for balance, core strength and stress reduction. 

 Light interval training (LIIT): A low-intensity workout that can increase stamina without the risk of overexertion. 

 Team or social sports: Football, basketball or other fun activities that involve full-body movement.

Cardio exercise: Fast walking, jogging, cycling, swimming or treadmill for effective calorie burning. 

 High-intensity interval training (HIIT): Combines periods of intense activity with recovery periods for maximum calorie burn in a short period of time. 

 Strength training: Lift weights at light to moderate intensity to increase muscle mass and metabolism. 

 Zumba or aerobics: A fun, full-body workout to increase stamina and calorie burn. 

 Flexibility and mobility training: Yoga or pilates to reduce the risk of injury, improve flexibility and balance.

Low to moderate cardio: Brisk walking, swimming or cycling can provide a good cardiovascular workout without putting excessive stress on the joints. 

 Low-intensity interval training (LIIT): Low-intensity interval training that is more suitable for gradually improving fitness. 

 Strength training: Using your own body (e.g. push-ups, squats) or light equipment to strengthen muscles and help burn calories. 

 Pilates: Focuses on improving core strength and body stability, as well as improving balance and flexibility. 

 Low-intensity exercises such as leisurely walking or swimming to improve endurance and calorie burning.
